articles.author: Jesse Pound
articles.title: Consumer sentiment falls in May as Americans' inflation expectations jump after tariffs - CNBC
articles.description: Year-ahead inflation expectations rose to 7.3% from 6.5% last month, according to a University of Michigan survey.
articles.content:
U.S. consumers are becoming increasingly worried that tariffs will lead to higher inflation, according to a University of Michigan survey released Friday.
The index of consumer sentiment dropped to … [+1847 chars]

articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: North America's 'broken heart': The billion-year-old scar from when the continent nearly ripped apart - Live Science
articles.description: The Midcontinent Rift is a giant tear that formed in what is now the U.S. Midwest 1.1 billion years ago. Nicknamed North America's "broken heart," it is filled with solidified magma and lava.
articles.content:
Name: The Midcontinent Rift
Location: U.S. Midwest
Why it's incredible: The rift nearly broke North America in half around 1 billion years ago.
